result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Dexter W. Matis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dexter W. Matis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dexter W. Matis was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Dexter W. Matis was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Dexter W. Matis in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14CM407 along with traffic citations.  Atty Schiek statment to court - 14CF210 - upon defendants plea of  guilty/no contest to count 1 -State will defer entry of conviction for 2 years and to counts 2 - and 3 - if defendant pleads no contest/guilty  - State moves to dismiss count 4 and withhold sentence and place on Probation for 2 years with fine/costs $479 along with  restitution of $4524.14 which includes 10% surcharge.
State will move to dismiss 14CM407 - but read in. 
 Atty Voorhees states that is the agreement and provides court with Deferred Entry Agreement. 

Court grants motion for count 2 to be amended to misdemeanor theft is granted/motion to dismiss count 4 granted and dismiss 14CM407  but will be read in  and dismiss traffic citations is granted (14TR2943, 14FO1016, 14TR2942, 14TR2941 and 14TR2940).  Defendant pleads No Contest to each count.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.

finds defendant guilty in count 2 as amended and count 3.

10:30 am - Defendant Dexter W. Matis in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Dexter W. Matis in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have stipulated to the use of the officer's report for the finding of probable cause.  State submit to Court Exhibit 1 (Report/CCAP printout) - Marked and Rec'd.  Court reviews and finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  State files Information.  Voorhees in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters a not guilty pleas on behalf of defendant.  Voorhees/Bednar motion to modify bond - Currently set at $500 cash with conditions.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
